header.titleText: Match the house to the poet
header.trailText: To mark World Poetry Day, tap on your literary intuition (or perhaps your real estate instinct) to guess where some of the world’s greatest poets lived. All the following houses belonged to poets at one point in their lives – can you figure out who lived in which?

questions.question: What happens next in this classic from '94?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: The red dot cross fades to a sun rising over the desert
Nervous lady goes to get cereal
The dot gets an adrenaline shot
They crash into a horse drawn cart
They crash into a truck full of manure
